checks.title: The services selector does not match any pods
checks.description: Makes sure that all Services targets a Pod

checks.title: The pod is not targeted by a service, skipping probe checks.
checks.description: Makes sure that all Pods have safe probe configurations

checks.title: local-path-provisioner ImagePullPolicy is not set to Always
checks.description: Makes sure that the pullPolicy is set to Always. This makes sure that imagePullSecrets are always validated.
checks.remediation: It's recommended to always set the ImagePullPolicy to Always, to make sure that the imagePullSecrets are always correct, and to always get the image you want.

checks.title: local-path-provisioner Container has no configured security context
checks.description: Makes sure that all pods have a security context with read only filesystem set
checks.remediation: Set securityContext to run the container in a more secure context.

checks.title: local-path-provisioner The container is running with a low user ID
checks.description: Makes sure that all pods have a security context with valid UID and GID set
checks.remediation: A userid above 10 000 is recommended to avoid conflicts with the host. Set securityContext.runAsUser to a value > 10000

checks.title: local-path-provisioner The container running with a low group ID
checks.description: Makes sure that all pods have a security context with valid UID and GID set
checks.remediation: A groupid above 10 000 is recommended to avoid conflicts with the host. Set securityContext.runAsGroup to a value > 10000

checks.title: local-path-provisioner CPU limit is not set
checks.description: Makes sure that all pods have resource limits and requests set. The --ignore-container-cpu-limit flag can be used to disable the requirement of having a CPU limit
checks.remediation: Resource limits are recommended to avoid resource DDOS. Set resources.limits.cpu

checks.title: local-path-provisioner Memory limit is not set
checks.description: Makes sure that all pods have resource limits and requests set. The --ignore-container-cpu-limit flag can be used to disable the requirement of having a CPU limit
checks.remediation: Resource limits are recommended to avoid resource DDOS. Set resources.limits.memory

checks.title: local-path-provisioner CPU request is not set
checks.description: Makes sure that all pods have resource limits and requests set. The --ignore-container-cpu-limit flag can be used to disable the requirement of having a CPU limit
checks.remediation: Resource requests are recommended to make sure that the application can start and run without crashing. Set resources.requests.cpu

checks.title: local-path-provisioner Memory request is not set
checks.description: Makes sure that all pods have resource limits and requests set. The --ignore-container-cpu-limit flag can be used to disable the requirement of having a CPU limit
checks.remediation: Resource requests are recommended to make sure that the application can start and run without crashing. Set resources.requests.memory

checks.title: local-path-provisioner Ephemeral Storage limit is not set
checks.description: Makes sure all pods have ephemeral-storage requests and limits set
checks.remediation: Resource limits are recommended to avoid resource DDOS. Set resources.limits.ephemeral-storage

checks.title: The pod does not have a matching NetworkPolicy
checks.description: Makes sure that all Pods are targeted by a NetworkPolicy
checks.remediation: Create a NetworkPolicy that targets this pod to control who/what can communicate with this pod. Note, this feature needs to be supported by the CNI implementation used in the Kubernetes cluster to have an effect.

checks.title: The pod does not have a matching NetworkPolicy
checks.description: Makes sure that all Pods are targeted by a NetworkPolicy
checks.remediation: Create a NetworkPolicy that targets this pod to control who/what can communicate with this pod. Note, this feature needs to be supported by the CNI implementation used in the Kubernetes cluster to have an effect.

checks.title: The pod is not targeted by a service, skipping probe checks.
checks.description: Makes sure that all Pods have safe probe configurations

checks.title: local-path-provisioner Container has no configured security context
checks.description: Makes sure that all pods have a security context with read only filesystem set
checks.remediation: Set securityContext to run the container in a more secure context.

checks.title: local-path-provisioner ImagePullPolicy is not set to Always
checks.description: Makes sure that the pullPolicy is set to Always. This makes sure that imagePullSecrets are always validated.
checks.remediation: It's recommended to always set the ImagePullPolicy to Always, to make sure that the imagePullSecrets are always correct, and to always get the image you want.

checks.title: Can elevate its own privileges
checks.description: A program inside the container can elevate its own privileges and run as root, which might give the program control over the container and node.
checks.remediation: Set 'set containers[].securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to 'false'.

checks.title: Runs as root user
checks.description: Force the running image to run as a non-root user to ensure least privileges.
checks.remediation: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsNonRoot' to true.

checks.title: Seccomp policies disabled
checks.description: A program inside the container can bypass Seccomp protection policies.
checks.remediation: Specify seccomp either by annotation or by seccomp profile type having allowed values as per pod security standards

checks.title: Can elevate its own privileges
checks.description: A program inside the container can elevate its own privileges and run as root, which might give the program control over the container and node.
checks.remediation: Set 'set containers[].securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to 'false'.

checks.title: Runs as root user
checks.description: Force the running image to run as a non-root user to ensure least privileges.
checks.remediation: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsNonRoot' to true.

checks.title: Specific capabilities added
checks.description: According to pod security standard 'Capabilities', capabilities beyond the default set must not be added.
checks.remediation: Do not set spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.add and spec.initContainers[*].securityContext.capabilities.add.

checks.title: Access to host ports
checks.description: According to pod security standard 'Host Ports', hostPorts should be disallowed, or at minimum restricted to a known list.
checks.remediation: Do not set spec.containers[*].ports[*].hostPort and spec.initContainers[*].ports[*].hostPort.

checks.title: Seccomp policies disabled
checks.description: A program inside the container can bypass Seccomp protection policies.
checks.remediation: Specify seccomp either by annotation or by seccomp profile type having allowed values as per pod security standards

checks.title: Prevent binding to privileged ports
checks.description: The ports which are lower than 1024 receive and transmit various sensitive and privileged data. Allowing containers to use them can bring serious implications.
checks.remediation: Do not map the container ports to privileged host ports when starting a container.

checks.title: Container has the same readiness and liveness probe
checks.description: Makes sure that all Pods have safe probe configurations
checks.remediation: Using the same probe for liveness and readiness is very likely dangerous. Generally it's better to avoid the livenessProbe than re-using the readinessProbe.

checks.title: Can elevate its own privileges
checks.description: A program inside the container can elevate its own privileges and run as root, which might give the program control over the container and node.
checks.remediation: Set 'set containers[].securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to 'false'.

checks.title: Access to host network
checks.description: Sharing the hosts network namespace permits processes in the pod to communicate with processes bound to the hosts loopback adapter.
checks.remediation: Do not set 'spec.template.spec.hostNetwork' to true.

checks.title: Runs as root user
checks.description: Force the running image to run as a non-root user to ensure least privileges.
checks.remediation: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsNonRoot' to true.

checks.title: hostPath volumes mounted
checks.description: According to pod security standard 'HostPath Volumes', HostPath volumes must be forbidden.
checks.remediation: Do not set 'spec.volumes[*].hostPath'.

checks.description: A program inside the container can bypass Seccomp protection policies.
checks.remediation: Specify seccomp either by annotation or by seccomp profile type having allowed values as per pod security standards

checks.remediation: A userid above 10 000 is recommended to avoid conflicts with the host. Set securityContext.runAsUser to a value > 10000

checks.title: coredns The container running with a low group ID
checks.description: Makes sure that all pods have a security context with valid UID and GID set
checks.remediation: A groupid above 10 000 is recommended to avoid conflicts with the host. Set securityContext.runAsGroup to a value > 10000

checks.title: coredns The pod has a container with a writable root filesystem
checks.description: Makes sure that all pods have a security context with read only filesystem set
checks.remediation: Set securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem to true

checks.title: coredns ImagePullPolicy is not set to Always
checks.description: Makes sure that the pullPolicy is set to Always. This makes sure that imagePullSecrets are always validated.
checks.remediation: It's recommended to always set the ImagePullPolicy to Always, to make sure that the imagePullSecrets are always correct, and to always get the image you want.

checks.description: Makes sure that all Pods are targeted by a NetworkPolicy
checks.remediation: Create a NetworkPolicy that targets this pod to control who/what can communicate with this pod. Note, this feature needs to be supported by the CNI implementation used in the Kubernetes cluster to have an effect.

checks.description: Makes sure that all pods have a security context with valid UID and GID set
checks.remediation: A groupid above 10 000 is recommended to avoid conflicts with the host. Set securityContext.runAsGroup to a value > 10000

checks.title: rke2-snapshot-validation-webhook CPU limit is not set
checks.description: Makes sure that all pods have resource limits and requests set. The --ignore-container-cpu-limit flag can be used to disable the requirement of having a CPU limit
checks.remediation: Resource limits are recommended to avoid resource DDOS. Set resources.limits.cpu

checks.title: rke2-snapshot-validation-webhook Memory limit is not set
checks.description: Makes sure that all pods have resource limits and requests set. The --ignore-container-cpu-limit flag can be used to disable the requirement of having a CPU limit
checks.remediation: Resource limits are recommended to avoid resource DDOS. Set resources.limits.memory

checks.title: rke2-snapshot-validation-webhook CPU request is not set
checks.description: Makes sure that all pods have resource limits and requests set. The --ignore-container-cpu-limit flag can be used to disable the requirement of having a CPU limit
checks.remediation: Resource requests are recommended to make sure that the application can start and run without crashing. Set resources.requests.cpu

checks.title: rke2-snapshot-validation-webhook Memory request is not set
checks.description: Makes sure that all pods have resource limits and requests set. The --ignore-container-cpu-limit flag can be used to disable the requirement of having a CPU limit
checks.remediation: Resource requests are recommended to make sure that the application can start and run without crashing. Set resources.requests.memory

checks.title: rke2-snapshot-validation-webhook Ephemeral Storage limit is not set
checks.description: Makes sure all pods have ephemeral-storage requests and limits set
checks.remediation: Resource limits are recommended to avoid resource DDOS. Set resources.limits.ephemeral-storage

checks.title: The pod does not have a matching NetworkPolicy
checks.description: Makes sure that all Pods are targeted by a NetworkPolicy
checks.remediation: Create a NetworkPolicy that targets this pod to control who/what can communicate with this pod. Note, this feature needs to be supported by the CNI implementation used in the Kubernetes cluster to have an effect.

checks.title: Container has the same readiness and liveness probe
checks.description: Makes sure that all Pods have safe probe configurations
checks.remediation: Using the same probe for liveness and readiness is very likely dangerous. Generally it's better to avoid the livenessProbe than re-using the readinessProbe.

checks.title: rke2-snapshot-validation-webhook ImagePullPolicy is not set to Always
checks.description: Makes sure that the pullPolicy is set to Always. This makes sure that imagePullSecrets are always validated.
checks.remediation: It's recommended to always set the ImagePullPolicy to Always, to make sure that the imagePullSecrets are always correct, and to always get the image you want.

checks.title: Manage configmaps
checks.description: Some workloads leverage configmaps to store sensitive data or configuration parameters that affect runtime behavior that can be modified by an attacker or combined with another issue to potentially lead to compromise.
checks.remediation: Remove write permission verbs for resource 'configmaps'

checks.title: Can elevate its own privileges
checks.description: A program inside the container can elevate its own privileges and run as root, which might give the program control over the container and node.
checks.remediation: Set 'set containers[].securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to 'false'.

checks.title: Seccomp policies disabled
checks.description: A program inside the container can bypass Seccomp protection policies.
checks.remediation: Specify seccomp either by annotation or by seccomp profile type having allowed values as per pod security standards

checks.title: Can elevate its own privileges
checks.description: A program inside the container can elevate its own privileges and run as root, which might give the program control over the container and node.
checks.remediation: Set 'set containers[].securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to 'false'.

checks.title: Access to host network
checks.description: Sharing the hosts network namespace permits processes in the pod to communicate with processes bound to the hosts loopback adapter.
checks.remediation: Do not set 'spec.template.spec.hostNetwork' to true.

checks.title: Runs as root user
checks.description: Force the running image to run as a non-root user to ensure least privileges.
checks.remediation: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsNonRoot' to true.

checks.title: hostPath volumes mounted
checks.description: According to pod security standard 'HostPath Volumes', HostPath volumes must be forbidden.
checks.remediation: Do not set 'spec.volumes[*].hostPath'.

checks.title: Seccomp policies disabled
checks.description: A program inside the container can bypass Seccomp protection policies.
checks.remediation: Specify seccomp either by annotation or by seccomp profile type having allowed values as per pod security standards

checks.title: Ingress and Egress blocked
checks.description: Disable Ingress and Egress traffic on all pods wherever possible. It is recommended to define restrictive network policy on all new pods, and then enable sources/destinations that this pod must communicate with.
checks.remediation: Define a network policy that restricts ingress and egress connections.

checks.title: Host PID/IPC privileges
checks.description: Containers should be isolated from the host machine as much as possible. The hostPID and hostIPC fields in deployment yaml may allow cross-container influence and may expose the host itself to potentially malicious or destructive actions. This control identifies all pods using hostPID or hostIPC privileges.
checks.remediation: Remove hostPID and hostIPC from the yaml file(s) privileges unless they are absolutely necessary.

checks.title: Configured liveness probe
checks.description: Liveness probe is intended to ensure that workload remains healthy during its entire execution lifecycle, or otherwise restrat the container. It is highly recommended to define liveness probe for every worker container. This control finds all the pods where the Liveness probe is not configured.
checks.remediation: Ensure Liveness probes are configured wherever possible.

checks.title: HostPath mount
checks.description: Mounting host directory to the container can be used by attackers to get access to the underlying host. This control identifies all the pods using hostPath mount.
checks.remediation: Remove hostPath mounts unless they are absolutely necessary and use exception mechanism to remove notifications.

checks.title: Allow privilege escalation
checks.description: Attackers may gain access to a container and uplift its privilege to enable excessive capabilities.
checks.remediation: If your application does not need it, make sure the allowPrivilegeEscalation field of the securityContext is set to false.

checks.title: Resources memory limit and request
checks.description: This control identifies all Pods for which the memory limit is not set.
checks.remediation: Set the memory limit or use exception mechanism to avoid unnecessary notifications.

checks.title: Resources CPU limit and request
checks.description: This control identifies all Pods for which the CPU limit is not set.
checks.remediation: Set the CPU limit or use exception mechanism to avoid unnecessary notifications.

checks.title: Linux hardening
checks.description: Containers may be given more privileges than they actually need. This can increase the potential impact of a container compromise.
checks.remediation: You can use AppArmor, Seccomp, SELinux and Linux Capabilities mechanisms to restrict containers abilities to utilize unwanted privileges.

checks.title: Resource limits
checks.description: CPU and memory resources should have a limit set for every container or a namespace to prevent resource exhaustion. This control identifies all the pods without resource limit definitions by checking their yaml definition file as well as their namespace LimitRange objects. It is also recommended to use ResourceQuota object to restrict overall namespace resources, but this is not verified by this control.
checks.remediation: Define LimitRange and Resource Limits in the namespace or in the deployment/pod manifests.

checks.title: List Kubernetes secrets
checks.description: Attackers who have permissions to access secrets can access sensitive information that might include credentials to various services. This control determines which user, group or service account can list/get secrets.
checks.remediation: Monitor and approve list of users, groups and service accounts that can access secrets. Use exception mechanism to prevent repetitive the notifications.

checks.title: Access container service account
checks.description: Attackers who obtain access to a pod can use its SA token to communicate with KubeAPI server. All pods with SA token mounted (if such token has a Role or a ClusterRole binding) are considerred potentially dangerous.
checks.remediation: Verify that RBAC is enabled. Follow the least privilege principle and ensure that only necessary pods have SA token mounted into them.

checks.title: Data Destruction
checks.description: Attackers may attempt to destroy data and resources in the cluster. This includes deleting deployments, configurations, storage, and compute resources. This control identifies all subjects that can delete resources.
checks.remediation: You should follow the least privilege principle and minimize the number of subjects that can delete resources.

checks.title: Automatic mapping of service account
checks.description: Potential attacker may gain access to a pod and steal its service account token. Therefore, it is recommended to disable automatic mapping of the service account tokens in service account configuration and enable it only for pods that need to use them.
checks.remediation: Disable automatic mounting of service account tokens to pods either at the service account level or at the individual pod level, by specifying the automountServiceAccountToken: false. Note that pod level takes precedence.

checks.remediation: Set the CPU limit or use exception mechanism to avoid unnecessary notifications.

checks.title: Linux hardening
checks.description: Containers may be given more privileges than they actually need. This can increase the potential impact of a container compromise.
checks.remediation: You can use AppArmor, Seccomp, SELinux and Linux Capabilities mechanisms to restrict containers abilities to utilize unwanted privileges.

checks.title: Resource limits
checks.description: CPU and memory resources should have a limit set for every container or a namespace to prevent resource exhaustion. This control identifies all the pods without resource limit definitions by checking their yaml definition file as well as their namespace LimitRange objects. It is also recommended to use ResourceQuota object to restrict overall namespace resources, but this is not verified by this control.
checks.remediation: Define LimitRange and Resource Limits in the namespace or in the deployment/pod manifests.

skippedChecks.title: Forbidden Container Registries
skippedChecks.description: In cases where the Kubernetes cluster is provided by a CSP (e.g., AKS in Azure, GKE in GCP, or EKS in AWS), compromised cloud credential can lead to the cluster takeover. Attackers may abuse cloud account credentials or IAM mechanism to the clusters management layer.
skippedChecks.remediation: Limit the registries from which you pull container images from

skippedChecks.title: Images from allowed registry
skippedChecks.description: This control is intended to ensure that all the used container images are taken from the authorized repositories. It allows user to list all the approved repositories and will fail all the images taken from any repository outside of this list.
skippedChecks.remediation: You should enable all trusted repositories in the parameters of this control.
